frame.name: Limitation
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> that would be expected to have a characteristic to a certain degree (typically based on comparison to other entities of the same type) instead has a more limited degree of that characteristic.
<ex>The <t>limitations</t> on the theory's applicability made it unpopular in its time.</ex>
<ex>Are there any undocumented <t>limitations</t> on the use of this machine?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> would normally be expected to have a set of possibilites, but instead exhibits only certain possibilites, or exhibits them on fewer situations than expected.
<ex><fex name="ent">Our technology</fex> has <t>limits</t> we didn't expect.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Entity</fen> is limited.
<ex>There are <fex name="deg">strong</fex> <t>limits</t> on its usefulness.</ex></def-root>
